intro: Digitalis erubescens, commonly known as the scarlet foxglove, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features tall, sparsely hairy stems that bear striking, hooded flowers in shades of pink to red. The plant's leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Digitalis erubescens is valued in gardens for its ornamental beauty and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
